message: The only way to do great work is to love what you do.
author: Steve Jobs

message: Believe you can and you're halfway there.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

message: Do not wait to strike till the iron is hot, but make it hot by striking.
author: William Butler Yeats

message: Success is not the key to happiness. Happiness is the key to success.
author: Albert Schweitzer

message: The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

message: It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.
author: Confucius

message: Your time is limited, don’t waste it living someone else’s life.
author: Steve Jobs

message: What we think, we become.
author: Buddha

message: You are never too old to set another goal or to dream a new dream.
author: C.S. Lewis

message: Success is not the result of spontaneous combustion. You must set yourself on fire.
author: Arnold H. Glasow

message: Keep your face always toward the sunshine—and shadows will fall behind you.
author: Walt Whitman

message: Opportunities don't happen, you create them.
author: Chris Grosser

message: What lies behind us and what lies before us are tiny matters compared to what lies within us.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

message: The only limit to our realization of tomorrow will be our doubts of today.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

message: The secret of getting ahead is getting started.
author: Mark Twain

message: Act as if what you do makes a difference. It does.
author: William James

message: Failure is simply the opportunity to begin again, this time more intelligently.
author: Henry Ford

message: You miss 100% of the shots you don’t take.
author: Wayne Gretzky

message: Strive not to be a success, but rather to be of value.
author: Albert Einstein

message: If you can dream it, you can do it.
author: Walt Disney

message: In the middle of every difficulty lies opportunity.
author: Albert Einstein

message: What we fear doing most is usually what we most need to do.
author: Tim Ferriss

message: Perseverance is not a long race; it is many short races one after the other.
author: Walter Elliot

message: Believe in yourself and all that you are. Know that there is something inside you that is greater than any obstacle.
author: Christian D. Larson

message: Dream big and dare to fail.
author: Norman Vaughan

message: It always seems impossible until it's done.
author: Nelson Mandela

message: Success usually comes to those who are too busy to be looking for it.
author: Henry David Thoreau

message: You must be the change you wish to see in the world.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

message: Keep going. Everything you need will come to you at the perfect time.
author: Unknown

message: The best way to predict the future is to create it.
author: Peter Drucker

message: It’s not whether you get knocked down, it’s whether you get up.
author: Vince Lombardi

message: Do what you can, with what you have, where you are.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

message: You are braver than you believe, stronger than you seem, and smarter than you think.
author: A.A. Milne

message: Start where you are. Use what you have. Do what you can.
author: Arthur Ashe

message: Hardships often prepare ordinary people for an extraordinary destiny.
author: C.S. Lewis

message: Perfection is not attainable, but if we chase perfection we can catch excellence.
author: Vince Lombardi

message: The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.
author: Walt Disney

message: You don’t have to be great to start, but you have to start to be great.
author: Zig Ziglar

message: Vision without execution is just hallucination.
author: Henry Ford

message: Happiness is not something ready-made. It comes from your own actions.
author: Dalai Lama

message: Don’t watch the clock; do what it does. Keep going.
author: Sam Levenson

message: Success is walking from failure to failure with no loss of enthusiasm.
author: Winston S. Churchill

message: Every day may not be good, but there is something good in every day.
author: Unknown

message: Be the change you wish to see.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

message: It is never too late to be what you might have been.
author: George Eliot

message: Do something today that your future self will thank you for.
author: Unknown

message: The harder you work for something, the greater you’ll feel when you achieve it.
author: Unknown

message: Success is not how high you have climbed, but how you make a positive difference to the world.
author: Roy T. Bennett

message: Instead of worrying about what you cannot control, shift your energy to what you can create.
author: Roy T. Bennett

message: Believe in the magic within you.
author: Unknown

message: Life is short. Do stuff that matters.
author: Unknown

message: Every moment is a fresh beginning.
author: T.S. Eliot
